questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to assign a phone number to User1 to meet the technical requirements.
How should you complete the command? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
A s of today the corrent command would be :
Set-CsPhoneNumberAssignment -Identity user1@Litwareinc.com -PhoneNumber +61370105550 -PhoneNumberType DirectRouting

The user is automatically Enterprise Voice enabled by the command.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/direct-routing-enable-users

You must consider everything when answering scenarios.
Here it says Litware will use a direct routing solution, therefore is -OnPremLineURI.

Those babbling about deprecation and stuff should also search with what is going to be substituted with (hint: is NOT LineURI, but a dedicated cmd-let).

It's for sure Set-CsUser -OnPremLineURI

comments.content: I fully agree with this comment. it's definitely -onpremlinuri

discussion.content:
correct answer: Set-CsUser -OnPremLineURI
Notes
Set-CsUser - setting the PSTN related parameters
Get-CsOnlineUser - getting the Online User settings
Only if a user is with Calling Plan 100% only the cmdlet
Get/Set-CsOnlineVoiceUser is the command

The task just says to assign a number to user1 who is at the corporate site. There is no info that this site use Teams Phone System so if user1 is just Sfb the -Lineuri is actually correct. Or am I missing smth?

comments.content: Yes you're because they have analog devices that must remain connected to the on-prem PBX

discussion.content: set-csOnlineVoiceUser doesnt have "LineURI" attribute

Once you assign a phone system license to a user with calling plan the users EV is automatically enabled. With just phone system for a DR user you need to enable EV with an on premises phone number. - which is why onlineuri makes the most sense.

Set-csuser and line uri are used primarily for on oprem SFB. WIth the move to SFB online - or Hybrid you will use Set-csOnlinevoiceuser - Telephone . or Set-csuser with Onpremi line uri , the same with Direct Route users.

I think I have come to agree with you.. Corporate sites have users who collaboration with Teams desktop and SPO. Which mean they are teams license. Sip trunks means the sip trunk provider would give numbers on premises numbers. So Set-csuser -Onpremlineuri 0-

I believe this answer is correct as this is not a hybrid configuration. 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/set-csuser?view=skype-ps
Shouldnt this be -OnPremLineUri?

comments.content: OnPremLineURI will be deprecated soon, so I'd go with LineURI.

I saw that message about OnPremLineUri being deprecated some time ago but not recently. Using "LineURI" doesn't work if you're running in the cloud - gives the following error:
Unable to set "LineURI". This parameter is restricted within Remote Tenant PowerShell
It's -LineURI as the answer, it does work now. You actually now get told to use -LineURI when running the cmdlet and using -OnPremLineURI does NOT work any more.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to assign a license to users to meet the technical requirements.
How should you complete the PowerShell script? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
I believe the answer is correct

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/assign-licenses-to-user-accounts-with-microsoft-365-powershell?view=o365-worldwide#assigning-licenses-to-user-accounts

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/enterprise-users/licensing-service-plan-reference

Answer is correct the Set-MsolUserLicense cmdlets are scheduled to be retired
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/assign-licenses-to-user-accounts-with-microsoft-365-powershell?view=o365-worldwide#use-the-microsoft-azure-active-directory-module-for-windows-powershell

Whilst not popular option to use to license users, this answer is correct. Check out https://practical365.com/microsoft-forces-move-from-azure-ad-cmdlets-for-license-management/ for more info. Microsoft are pushing admins onto Graph API for admin tasks.

Answer choices provided here are incorrect

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/enterprise/assign-licenses-to-user-accounts-with-microsoft-365-powershell?view=o365-worldwide#assigning-licenses-to-user-accounts
Set-MsolUserLicense and MCOEV are the correct answers. But Set-MsolUserLicense is not an option

choices.B: Create a resource account for each intercom.
choices.D: Create a configuration profile for IP phones.
choices.A: Create a trusted application endpoint for Teams.
choices.C: Register the ATAs with a Teams-certified SBC.
choices.E: Enable Direct Routing to a Teams-certified SBC.

discussion.content: https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-teams-community-blog/how-to-address-analogue-devices-in-a-digital-world-with-teams/ba-p/2945442

questions.question_text:
You need to connect the analog intercoms to Teams Phone.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

DRAG DROP -
You need to migrate a Vancouver facility user named jsmith from Skype for Business Server to Teams.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Does anyone think if 1, 3, 2 is also correct? I just thought Phone System license can be also applied to the user after migration.

comments.content:
apologies the scenarion below that is more applicable, 3,1,2 is correct
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/upgrade-to-teams-on-prem-pstn-considerations#from-skype-for-business-server-on-premises-with-enterprise-voice-to-direct-routing

correct as based on point 4 from the following link
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/upgrade-to-teams-on-prem-pstn-considerations#from-skype-for-business-online-with-on-premises-voice
I believe its 3,1,2. first move-csuser to teams and the you can give voice routing policies not the other way around.

discussion.content: 3,2,1 is the correct answer, you assign voice routing policy during the staging phase before migrating the user using cs-move command

Selected Answer: C
Trusted IP address are the Internet(Public) IP Address of the enterprise network exempted from any security options.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C
Correct answer is C.
What address is being checked? The external address, is that the address in the route to Azure/O365?
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/cloud-voice-network-settings#trusted-ip-address

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing. The deployment has the following configurations:
✑ Direct Routing Session Border Controller (SBC) public IP subnet: 198.51.100.0/24
✑ Teams client external IP subnet: 203.0.113.0/24
✑ Teams client internal IP subnet: 192.168.0.0/24
You need to configure the network topology to support emergency call routing.
Which network range should you add to the trusted IP addresses?
